trans-unit.source: MapReduce and Remote Desktop with Hadoop in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: MapReduce and Remote Desktop with Hadoop in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Remote Desktop to connect to Hadoop on HDInsight and run MapReduce jobs.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Remote Desktop to connect to Hadoop on HDInsight and run MapReduce jobs.

trans-unit.source: Use MapReduce in Hadoop on HDInsight with Remote Desktop
trans-unit.target: Use MapReduce in Hadoop on HDInsight with Remote Desktop

trans-unit.source: In this article, you will learn how to connect to a Hadoop on HDInsight cluster by using Remote Desktop and then run MapReduce jobs by using the Hadoop command.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you will learn how to connect to a Hadoop on HDInsight cluster by using Remote Desktop and then run MapReduce jobs by using the Hadoop command.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To complete the steps in this article, you will need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete the steps in this article, you will need the following:

trans-unit.source: A Windows-based HDInsight (Hadoop on HDInsight) cluster
trans-unit.target: A Windows-based HDInsight (Hadoop on HDInsight) cluster

trans-unit.source: A client computer running Windows 10, Windows 8, or Windows 7
trans-unit.target: A client computer running Windows 10, Windows 8, or Windows 7

trans-unit.source: Connect with Remote Desktop
trans-unit.target: Connect with Remote Desktop

trans-unit.source: Enable Remote Desktop for the HDInsight cluster, then connect to it by following the instructions at [Connect to HDInsight clusters using RDP](hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal.md#rdp).
trans-unit.target: Enable Remote Desktop for the HDInsight cluster, then connect to it by following the instructions at [Connect to HDInsight clusters using RDP](hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal.md#rdp).

trans-unit.source: Use the Hadoop command
trans-unit.target: Use the Hadoop command

trans-unit.source: When you are connected to the desktop for the HDInsight cluster, use the following steps to run a MapReduce job by using the Hadoop command:
trans-unit.target: When you are connected to the desktop for the HDInsight cluster, use the following steps to run a MapReduce job by using the Hadoop command:

trans-unit.source: From the HDInsight desktop, start the **Hadoop Command Line**.
trans-unit.target: From the HDInsight desktop, start the **Hadoop Command Line**.

trans-unit.source: This opens a new command prompt in the **c:\apps\dist\hadoop-<version number>** directory.
trans-unit.target: This opens a new command prompt in the **c:\apps\dist\hadoop-<version number>** directory.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The version number changes as Hadoop is updated.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The version number changes as Hadoop is updated.

trans-unit.source: The **HADOOP_HOME** environment variable can be used to find the path.
trans-unit.target: The **HADOOP_HOME** environment variable can be used to find the path.

trans-unit.source: For example, `cd %HADOOP_HOME%` changes directories to the Hadoop directory, without requiring you to know the version number.
trans-unit.target: For example, `cd %HADOOP_HOME%` changes directories to the Hadoop directory, without requiring you to know the version number.

trans-unit.source: To use the **Hadoop** command to run an example MapReduce job, use the following command:
trans-unit.target: To use the **Hadoop** command to run an example MapReduce job, use the following command:

trans-unit.source: This starts the **wordcount** class, which is contained in the **hadoop-mapreduce-examples.jar** file in the current directory.
trans-unit.target: This starts the **wordcount** class, which is contained in the **hadoop-mapreduce-examples.jar** file in the current directory.

trans-unit.source: As input, it uses the **wasb://example/data/gutenberg/davinci.txt** document, and output is stored at: **wasb:///example/data/WordCountOutput**.
trans-unit.target: As input, it uses the **wasb://example/data/gutenberg/davinci.txt** document, and output is stored at: **wasb:///example/data/WordCountOutput**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] for more information about this MapReduce job and the example data, see Use MapReduce in HDInsight Hadoop.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] for more information about this MapReduce job and the example data, see Use MapReduce in HDInsight Hadoop.

trans-unit.source: The job emits details as it is processed, and it returns information similar to the following when the job is complete:
trans-unit.target: The job emits details as it is processed, and it returns information similar to the following when the job is complete:

trans-unit.source: When the job is complete, use the following command to list the output files stored at **wasb://example/data/WordCountOutput**:
trans-unit.target: When the job is complete, use the following command to list the output files stored at **wasb://example/data/WordCountOutput**:

trans-unit.source: This should display two files, **_SUCCESS** and **part-r-00000**.
trans-unit.target: This should display two files, **_SUCCESS** and **part-r-00000**.

trans-unit.source: The **part-r-00000** file contains the output for this job.
trans-unit.target: The **part-r-00000** file contains the output for this job.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Some MapReduce jobs may split the results across multiple **part-r-#####** files.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Some MapReduce jobs may split the results across multiple **part-r-#####** files.

trans-unit.source: If so, use the ##### suffix to indicate the order of the files.
trans-unit.target: If so, use the ##### suffix to indicate the order of the files.

trans-unit.source: To view the output, use the following command:
trans-unit.target: To view the output, use the following command:

trans-unit.source: This displays a list of the words that are contained in the **wasb://example/data/gutenberg/davinci.txt** file, along with the number of times each word occured.
trans-unit.target: This displays a list of the words that are contained in the **wasb://example/data/gutenberg/davinci.txt** file, along with the number of times each word occured.

trans-unit.source: The following is an example of the data that will be contained in the file:
trans-unit.target: The following is an example of the data that will be contained in the file:

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: As you can see, the Hadoop command provides an easy way to run MapReduce jobs on an HDInsight cluster and then view the job output.
trans-unit.target: As you can see, the Hadoop command provides an easy way to run MapReduce jobs on an HDInsight cluster and then view the job output.
